title: Took a month or two off ranked play, was a bad experience, came back and....
body:
First game, played as support, we were doing OK. Graves on my team went AFK. 

These are rare occurrences, that we selectively remember according to lyte. So tried again today.


I played adc, guy who didnt get his jungle roll took xerath support.....Now Ive seen this work, but this guy wasent someone who even understood a little bit what bot lane en-tales. Blasted minions, fed other laners,  pushed waves when we should have been freezing near turret. I was Jinx, and thinking that id get to late game and be useful, however top lane mundo fed a bunch of kills to Jax...blamed jungle, started feeding (and talking about feeding..we will see if the report works) and generally talking smack to our team...he caused a melt-down. 

Another rare occurrence.


Ill try number 3 tonight.



**Edit**: After watching some "top soloq players" games, had a realization. 

This is just how the game is, doesn't matter if bronze or challenger.

First game I saw a guy named japaneseman (Or japanman or something) feed a bunch of kills as TF mid, then go stand in the fountain...every now and then he would move a little, most likely to avoid an afk, but the bad part was that the rest of the team was doing well, and held out for quite a while before losing....Although I cant read the chat on spectated games, Ill bet it was the junglers fault or something, guy didn't do well so didn't want to play any more. Team would ping him sometimes, then he would do a lap or two around the fountain before just standing there again. (Baby)

Next game was a complete one sided stomp, losing team surrendered at 20.

Last game I saw piglet feeding. He got killed a few times in bot lane as Lucian, then every time he went to lane he was going all in, over and over and over (and dying)...Just like the baddies I complain about...obviously piglet is no baddie though.


This is the same crap that bothers me in my games, I think the entire game is just like this and either you deal or you leave. 

TLDR: Game is just like this, from the lowest to highest ranks. Either deal with it or stop playing.

replies.body:
I've also recently started queuing for ranked matches again.

I ended up hovering between Silver I and Silver II with ~1500 MMR last season from my placements, and the sheer amount of toxicity was astounding. My games are a more accurate measure of my abilities to get 4 Hitlers (There are still plenty of nice players for the record.) to co-operate than my own mechanics.

I was placed in Bronze I this season, and I'm slowly climbing back to Silver I. The lower tiers were just as toxic, but at least I can hard-carry my team most often.
I dread going back to Silver I and begin facing opponents with decent mechanics who I can't carry against again.

The reports system is far too ineffective. From my games, I've noticed the same toxic players over and over again who would flame their teammates. Sometimes, I will just dodge these games if I see that someone is on their promos.

Ranked restrictions needs to be dealt more harshly and swiftly. Keep those who aren't serious about it in normals, Ranked should be reserved for those who can respect their team by giving 100% of their effort.

Yeah, the current system just feels so lenient, yet we already see so many QQ-ers about chat bans saying that they did nothing wrong (nothing means only raging every secong game, because they usually don't rage in games that they win). Some of them even believe that they are doing the right thing.
THIS.  So tired of seeing it.

No, people get angry, AFK, feed because they are as emotionally mature as a two year old on no-doze. I've never felt it justified, nor ever felt the urge to rage at someone over a game. Do I roll my eyes and say "idiot"? Yep. Do I facepalm when someone feeds an easy kill? Sure. But since I left puberty and hormones behind with my teen years, I've no want, need, or desire to type idiotic abuses and insults into chat, primarily because it ACCOMPLISHES ABSOLUTELY NOTHING.

Stop and think about what you just said. You want to replace a fairly objective team oriented metric and replace it with a subjectively biased INDIVIDUAL one. And you think that will make things better? How is that even remotely logical? You think raging over a KS/taking minions/etc.  is bad now, just wait until it actually affects someone's rating directly. Jumping Jesus on a Kangaroo it would make the tribunal cases today look like a British Manual on Courtly Etiquette. The game would devolve into a 1v9 profanity/death threat laden rage fest as you not only fight the other team to win, but you also fight with your teammates to boost your own stats. Might as well just ditch the whole team thing altogether and turn the game into an FPS.

This is a team game, and your performance measured by how you play on a team. It's a pickup game, so sometimes you're going to get lucky and get a good crew, and other times you're not. Sometimes you're going to be the star player and other times you're going to be the weight dragging the team down. If you are better than where you are, then over the long term you will rise (long term meaning more than one game). But oddly enough, being a raging xxxhole doesn't make you a better player. Telling you're teammates to go die in a fire doesn't suddenly raise their MMR or yours by 100 points. In fact, it's pretty much guaranteed being a raging xxxhole to your team is a good way to bring down the performance of your team, increases the likelihood they're going to feed/afk/troll, and more than certainly increase the likelihood you'll lose and get reported for being a raging xxxhole.

There is absolutely zero reason to rage at someone over a game. None. It's a game.

I didn't even finish reading this whole post that's how wrong it is.

Riot took a scoring system devised for individual on individual completion and brought it into a team base strategy game. That right there should tell you that the system will not function as intended, it doesn't have the necessary analysis points to make accurate determinations since the only data points it uses are win or loss. The system was effed from the get and it's never been improved, meaning as the amount of participants it assesses goes up, the more mistakes it makes. In other words, as long as league continues to grow, the system will become less and less effective, and it was already ineffective to start with. The system gets worse every day it assesses a new player. That's the reality.

Actually their team-game-adaptation of a "system designed for individual on individual competition" worked decently well, it has only seriously gone downhill since they added their own original elements to it in the form of the rank/LP/promo system.

Like seriously, with the old MMR/elo system you could see your progress and set short term goals, you just didn't get a digital pat on the back for meeting them except when you hit a new rank altogether.

Suddenly Riot decided "buh muh short term goals" and invented the current system, which is extremely restrictive, causes unnecessary tension around completely arbitrary "promotion series", and overall just limits progression to the point where it is possible to be playing at and be matched with players at, a level divisions or even sometimes more than a tier, above where you are actually ranked. The ranking system is just too divorced from the matchmaking sys tem.

For example, the pivotal moment when I quit this shitty ranked system was when I realised I was playing diamond players just to progress in plat - in the old system this would be IMPOSSIBLE because mmr is mmr is mmr - where you were ranked is where you were matched.

The old system using purely elo was still only effective and accurate at the highest levels of play. It was never a good system to implement and it's never worked well. The addition of the league system and the arbitrary promotion series only did one thing. I'll get to it in a sec. The old elo system had 5 natural chaos points around the mmr points that defined each tier. When you approached these points is when "elo hell" would emerge because of, as you stated, the increased tension and pressure of players playing to finally achieve a goal. Trolling around these points was always much greater than points where ranking up or down was not the end result of a game. With the addition of the league system riot introduced 4 new chaos vortices WITHIN each division, or 4 additional points at which trolling would occur due to players being overly invested in those particular games. Thus, instead of having 5 widely separated "elo hell" chaos vortices we now have 5 in every tier and an additional tier to go along with it. That means we now have 30+ points along the ladder at which toxicity is at it's highest. In other words, riot decided instead of having a couple of toxic rungs on the ladder that the whole ladder needed to be toxic. That's pretty much the exact opposite of what riot says it's policy is, namely that the company works to reduce toxicity. They do not, folks. They are lying to you when they say this. Why? Because riot earns more money from banning players permanently and getting them to repurchase everything on brand new accounts. They implemented the new system solely as a way to increase revenue.

My stats may not be the same for everyone, and I don't expect they are, but I at least provided evidence to back up my claims, whereas he simply just said some numbers and expected us to go with it because "reasons". 

While he may not be 100% wrong (even though I don't believe he is 100% right either), he has no proof to back up his claims, compared to my own personal experiences that tell me otherwise, hence the frustration at times.

The problem with his ball of stats is that as opposed to your baseball of stats, he has something approximating a small moon.  He can't just wave the data around because it is ridiculously huge.  The best he can do is show the statistics that have been gathered from the data, and that still comes down to him just saying what they are.  He _can't_ provide the proof (whether or not it exists), it just wouldn't be at all practical unless everyone had some good statistical analysis software.

I get that you are frustrated at the situation, but Lyte can't really do anything other than just say what the results he has are.

The thing is that it *is* bad luck on your part. If you discount the afk player himself, every time someone afks 4 people are negatively affected while 5 are "positively" affected. That is a fact without argument. Given random assignment, every four times you get an afk on your team you should expect to get 5 on the enemy team. If this isn't the case there are 3 possibilities:

1) Riot hates you and matches you with players that it predicts will afk
